column1: Mitch McConnell continúa obstaculizando legislación de alivio para el #COVID19 a pesar de un número récord de casos este pasado fin de semana. El @SenateGOP DEBE actuar.   https://t.co/FK9WmSufSX
Mitch McConnell is continuing to block coronavirus relief legislation despite a record number of #COVID19 cases this past weekend. The @SenateGOP MUST Act. https://t.co/5FcrtC6ydn
Tragically Fresno County had six new fatal cases of #COVID19 this weekend. We don't want to see these numbers continue to rise so please do your part to slow the spread.  https://t.co/6ZOENPoeb7

Trágicamente el condado de Fresno agregó seis nuevos casos fatales de #COVID19 este fin de semana. No queremos que estos números sigan aumentando por favor haga su parte para reducir la propagación. https://t.co/6ZOENPoeb7

Tragically Fresno County had six new fatal cases of #COVID19 this weekend.  We don't want to see these numbers continue to rise so please do your part to slow the spread.   https://t.co/6ZOENP6CMx  #StaySafe #DoYourPart
COVID-19 has proved to be a challenge for our farmers that’s why in Congress I made sure producers get what they need to weather the pandemic by passing CFAP PPP USDA aid. https://t.co/vMOwI7Q5dU

In Congress I'm making sure we have the resources protections and solutions we need crush this virus & get our economy moving again through the CARES Act Heroes Act Families First Coronavirus Act and more. I'm here for you and I never forget work for you. https://t.co/r0y7NmJDFE
There’s a plan for Covid-19 that just needs a Senate vote and Trump and the Republicans need to learn to say YES!

- I made sure a broad set of Valley crops (like grapes raisins and pima cotton) were eligible for relief funds like the Coronavirus Farm Assistance Program.  - I voted to make the Social Security Administration more responsive to the Americans it serves. (2/2)

If we want to reopen our businesses & restart our economy we have to do so in a smart safe way. Beating this virus means stopping the spread - that requires active participation in prevention tactics from everyone. #MaskUp #WashYourHands #SocialDistance https://t.co/dtDyn4G625

There is NOTHING more important than passing a new COVID relief package to directly help working families and stop kids from going hungry.   This tweet tantrum shows Donald Trump and his enablers don't care enough to end this pandemic.

Praying for the first family & everyone who has contracted Covid. If the President & First Lady can be infected anyone can. We must pass Heroes Act to support communities & those on the frontlines. Wash your hands wear a mask socially distance. Stay safe!

I'm so happy to hear we have COVID-19 more under control & can open up businesses at 25% capacity. Though great news we must continue to put safety first. This battle is not over - we need to pass the Heroes Act to have the tools to fight this pandemic. https://t.co/pPcb476Ipc

I'm so happy to hear we have COVID-19 more under control & can open up businesses at 25% capacity. Though great news we must continue to put safety first. This battle is not over - we need to pass the Heroes Act to have the tools to fight this pandemic. https://t.co/pPcb476Ipc

I'm honored to receive the endorsement of @314Action whose goal is to elect more STEM professionals like myself. COVID-19 has highlighted the importance of electing people who put science first when finding solutions to our most pressing challenges. https://t.co/PSoPUQv27x
Workers shouldn't have to fear for their safety at work following COVID-19 guidelines is the absolute minimum businesses can do for their workers is keep them safe. https://t.co/gR7p81piEJ

Thank you @CASenCaballero & @mhurtadoCA for voting to extend eviction protections for those impacted by COVID-19 in California until Jan. 2021. The US Senate needs to follow suit by passing the Heroes Act. It's the right thing to do. https://t.co/JMoNbVi5Mc
Our rural communities are being hit hard by Covid-19. This is yet another reminder of why we need accessible affordable health care here in the Valley.  https://t.co/vlfBXUqem3
Our rural communities are being hit hard by Covid-19. This is yet another reminder of why we need accessible affordable health care here in the Valley.  https://t.co/vlfBXUqem3

There's no doubt about it...we need rapid Covid-19 tests.   Why has Trump waited this long for a rapid test solution? Many of these tests are in short supply and the ones that are available aren't as reliable. We need a national testing strategy.   https://t.co/vOeUh1sran
Kern County: Sign up to get tested for Covid-19 at the Kern County Fairgrounds in Bakersfield while the site is still here. It's drive-through only and open from 7am-7pm.  https://t.co/Tf9EnewxZE

Listen to Dr. Fauci. He's warning us that the Central Valley is a concerning Covid hotspot. Make sure you're adhering to public health guidelines to keep you and your community safe.  https://t.co/xXY1OhHjRq

Thank you to the Central Valley Community Foundation for providing hospital beds to farmworkers that test positive for Covid-19. One in four jobs in the Fresno area are in agriculture and we need to make sure our workers are protected.  https://t.co/AJ5UQ0heBt
10000 Californians have died due to Covid-19. This is a terrible tragedy for our state.   We don't want to see these numbers rise so please do your part to slow the spread.  https://t.co/2HIz1Kay2o

Kern County: Good Samaritan Hospital & The California Farmworkers Foundation are collaborating on new mobile Covid-19 testing sites throughout the county with a new schedule each week to test farmworkers who have been hit particularly hard by the virus. https://t.co/uEo2EurZPn

The White House Covid-19 task force is warning California about rising case numbers here in the Central Valley. We're a hot spot right now and we need to stay safe. Wear a mask wash your hands and socially distance.  https://t.co/EgnoohpkZX

Good news for the Valley! The Wonderful company has announced that they will be donating $1 million for a Covid-19 Central Valley relief fund. These funds will go to nonprofits and schools around the Valley. Thank you! https://t.co/aXQVS7xlkp

Central Valley Update: Governor Newsom has ordered Covid-19 strike teams to respond to our virus outbreak in the region. Case numbers are rising to dangerous levels here. Please stay safe! https://t.co/wNwuMdT3Ak

California tragically lost 214 people on Friday alone to Covid-19 breaking the record for the 5th time in July. Let's work together to make sure this trend doesn't continue into August. Wear your mask wash your hands and socially distance.  https://t.co/z4pMB3dh5R
Love in the time of coronavirus. https://t.co/lWCpv3T1Ls

Listen to this important message from our public health officials. Please avoid public gatherings even if you're young and healthy as you could unknowingly spread Covid-19 to others who might be more vulnerable.   https://t.co/nwSFhoVQu8

Fresno & Tulare Counties: Check out this interactive map featuring Covid-19 case counts by zip code as well as a map of all testing locations near you! #StaySafe #SlowTheSpread https://t.co/dIzhZ1H8yz

Small towns in the Central Valley are being left behind by Covid-19 relief legislation. That's why I sent a letter to Congressional Leadership asking that small towns be included in the next relief package. https://t.co/Er0iBK2DV9 https://t.co/SXpgNNvaQ3
The Central Valley is a Covid-19 hotspot. 🔥⚠️  We need more testing but in the meantime we must remain focused on mask-wearing hand washing and social distancing.  https://t.co/lPD06VJUtL

The economic impact of Covid-19 has made it difficult for many Californians particularly in Latino & Black communities to pay rent. We need to ensure that protections are in place so Covid-19 does not continue to exacerbate racial inequity in housing. https://t.co/QnUspfdiPR

This is scary stuff. Covid-19 aggressively attacks the lungs and can cause a wide array of other symptoms too putting a heavy strain on our hospital systems.   Listen to Dr. Fayed: Don't let down your guard. Stay safe.  https://t.co/e3kMgPrC01

Look at this invite: not a single mention of masks or social distancing.   In case David Valadao forgot COVID cases are surging here in the Valley. But I guess raising money is more important to you than keeping your community safe and alive. https://t.co/Lt4YFqG8gO

Minority and low-income areas are being hit hard by the Covid-19 testing shortages here in CA. This is unacceptable. To slow the spread of the pandemic we need widespread free (!) testing that offers results ASAP not weeks later.  https://t.co/Ao9d3VGYZQ
Are Covid-19 cases rising in your neighborhood? Towns of all sizes throughout the Valley are experiencing a surge in cases. Check out the data from your area here.  https://t.co/FQwjc8Id5K

Younger people are not immune from the coronavirus. Valley Children's is admitting children with Covid-19 cases. We are all vulnerable to this virus so please stay safe and wear a mask. https://t.co/fMqqJyj4p3

The Central Valley has been hit hard by Covid-19. Our hospitals are at capacity which puts a major strain on our health care system. Let's help them out by staying home if possible social distancing and always wearing a mask in public.  https://t.co/3W45wJcVxC

1 in 96 (‼️) Californians have been infected by the coronavirus thus far. We're breaking records and not the good kind. It takes all of us to keep our communities safe. #SlowTheSpread  https://t.co/QSGbTlhOa8
Another reminder that California is not in the clear with Covid-19. We now have more cases than New York. Please be safe!  https://t.co/M4yS8cNktd

We must take the virus seriously. It takes all of us to slow the spread of Covid-19 here in the Central Valley. We all have to do our part: wash your hands wear a mask stay home when you can and social distance when you can't.  https://t.co/Pqn7JEREUi
Did you know that 33000 lives could be saved by October 1st if 95% of us wore masks in public? Do your part to slow the spread of Covid-19 and #WearAMask.  https://t.co/PR48DueXRW

The CIF has delayed fall high school sports to spring due to Covid. This is disappointing for many kids like my own but let's use this as a reminder that the sooner we do our part to slow the spread the sooner we can return to sports & life.  https://t.co/zbHU1ALYIL

Thank you Councilman @BryanOsorioT for hosting this Meet & Greet with me! It was great to talk with our constituents about the critical issues we're facing today: healthcare criminal justice reform the impact of Covid-19 and more. Keep an eye out for our next event! https://t.co/NtG8WmGWCJ
Are you or someone you know out of work as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic? Here's a list of current job openings here in the Central Valley.  https://t.co/PA6LR6rjiK

My wife Kathy is a pediatrician so I see firsthand how hard it is to be a healthcare worker during the pandemic. Our doctors & nurses are overwhelmed with Covid patients; let's help them out by wearing a mask and social distancing. https://t.co/dQfD3NV7D6

As we formulate plans to bring our kids back to school we can't forget about our hardworking dedicated teachers. Many teachers could be at higher risk for Covid-19 and we have to make sure they too are protected.  https://t.co/77UbHP5IIp

As California Covid-19 test positivity rates reach dangerous highs of 7.7% Governor Newsom in consultation with public health experts has enacted temporary closures of  🛒 Shopping Malls 🏋🏻‍♀️ Gyms ⛪️ Indoor Churches 💅 Nail Salons https://t.co/TlIDjBOHjs

Our local health care systems here in the Valley are in need of more resources as they treat Covid-19 patients. Cases are spiking and we must ensure that all of our health care workers are equipped with masks and proper PPE.  https://t.co/umDgHisCRJ

Did you know that California has a Covid-19 hotline that will help answer any questions you have regarding the pandemic?  Call 833-422-4255 on Mon-Fri from 8-8 and Sat-Sun from 8-5 to get your questions answered.  https://t.co/aB6tJSUpFu

In his Fourth of July speech Trump claimed that 99% of Covid cases are "completely harmless." Fact check: that's not true. Please stay safe and remember to wear a mask in public or anytime you can't maintain social distancing. https://t.co/QBnmNdxk4I

Latinos of working age are getting sick and dying of Covid-19 at disproportionate numbers here in California. We must make sure that our frontline workers and their families are protected and have access to testing and treatment.  https://t.co/qxMdNy1svq

27% of rural Americans lack reliable broadband access at home. That's unacceptable and it's why I wrote a letter urging congressional leadership to include investments in broadband internet for rural Californians in the next Covid-19 relief package.  https://t.co/TfLtRq7q7Z

Here in California we're lucky to be surrounded by so many beautiful parks. If you're planning to go camping at one of them this summer take a look at this article that answers all the questions you might have regarding Covid-19 precautions.  https://t.co/PmVaHIT9Sy

As we approach the holiday weekend remember that our fight against Covid-19 is not over. I trust our community to find new ways to celebrate the 4th this year while following virus safety precautions. Stay safe and stay healthy!  https://t.co/LfBVce1DPy

⚠️ Fresno Tulare Kings & Kern Counties: @CAGovernor Newsom has closed bars due to escalating numbers of COVID-19 cases in our region. Please stay safe and keep those around you safe and healthy. https://t.co/4wfoAcaDOa

🚨California is breaking records with Covid-19 hospitalizations and daily case totals. The virus is still here and we have to be vigilant.   Remember to socially distance and wear a mask where distancing is not possible.  https://t.co/i7ALAOX2Ou
Not only is Trump endangering people by trying to stop testing he's continuing to put Asian Americans at risk by using racist nicknames for Covid-19. This must stop. https://t.co/cmF5XcYbwU

If you're 65+ your age puts you in an at-risk group for Covid-19. Please try to stay home as much as possible. For assistance and other services check out this graphic from @CalAging. https://t.co/mIX4wxqzAZ

Going on a road trip with the family this summer?   Here are some tips on what to pack to stay safe during the Covid-19 pandemic. Included: hand sanitizer masks and disinfecting wipes.  https://t.co/i88GC0ywcv

COVID-19 is disproportionately affecting Latino communities. The mortality rate of 35-44-year-olds is 8x higher among Latinos than whites. This is dangerous and inequitable. We must increase testing and contact tracing to keep communities of color safe. https://t.co/f9VIXwdpAd

This study found Filipino Americans in CA who live with healthcare workers or have risk factors for Covid-19 have not been tested & aren't aware of testing sites. We must ensure that EVERY community has equitable access to testing and contact tracing.  https://t.co/1yLfJ4HHht

Trump just referred to Covid-19 as the "kung flu" to rile up supporters at his rally.   122000 Americans have died from this disease yet he still finds it funny to make racist jokes about the virus that target Asian Americans.  https://t.co/zhCvZNkSvB

Happy to announce that the Kings County Area Public Transit Agency (KCAPTA) is receiving $8.9 million in CARES Act federal funding. These funds will help KCAPTA cover operating and maintenance costs incurred from the Covid-19 pandemic.
NEW: @CAGovernor Newsom has issued a statewide mask order. This means that face coverings are required in public. Stay safe and help slow the spread of Covid-19. https://t.co/qt2vRwMy3C

I'm pushing the Department of Agriculture to establish a Covid-19 rural task force that will draw attention to issues the Central Valley is facing like the lack of broadband internet access to healthcare and the loss of crops for our farmers.  https://t.co/NTcHXbzwu9

If you live in Kings County you are eligible to receive a free Covid-19 test -- even if you're asymptomatic or don't have insurance and regardless of your immigration status.   https://t.co/iSajWvS2dU

As of today we have lost over 112000 Americans to the coronavirus. Each of those souls left someone behind. To all those who have lost a loved one to the virus we are thinking of you. https://t.co/UdBQX9ONdE

CDC guidelines are clear: covering your face in public slows the spread of Covid-19. You might have the virus without even knowing it so wearing a mask keeps you from spreading droplets to others.   Be considerate. Trust science. Slow the spread.  https://t.co/lQMXsnVXzm

If you’ve recovered from Covid-19 you might be able to help those who are still sick.   Consider donating your blood plasma today!  California donation centers can be found here:  https://t.co/eR3fEAEKcP

To safely open up our economy we need widespread access to coronavirus testing particularly in rural communities here in the Central Valley. It’s great that Kern County is opening six free coronavirus test sites this week. https://t.co/yezHzhskdw

We can't leave the people who build our country behind during this crisis. I'll fight to make sure we put hundreds of thousands of workers like @GoIUPAT members to work to help our nation recover from #COVID19 so we can all get back to work. https://t.co/MNgbyC4asT
